1.t: Blessed is He in whose hands is the Kingdom and who has power over all things.
1.tr: Tabaarakal lazee biyadihil mulku Wa-huwa 'alaa kulli shai-in qadeer

2.t: It is He who has created death and life to put you to the test and see which of you is most virtuous in your deeds. He is Majestic and All-forgiving.
2.tr: Allazee khalaqal mawta walhayaata liyabluwakum ayyukum ahsanu 'amalaa; Wa-huwal 'azeezul ghafoor

3.t: It is He who has created seven heavens, one above the other. You can see no flaw in the creation of the Beneficent God. Look again. Can you see faults?
3.tr: Allazee khalaqa sab'a samaawaatin tibaaqaa maa taraa fee khalqir rahmaani min tafaawut farji'il basara hal taraa min futoor

4.t: Look twice (and keep on looking), your eyes will only become dull and tired.
4.tr: Summar ji'il basara karrataini yanqalib ilaikal basaru khaasi'anw Wa-huwa haseer

5.t: We have decked the lowest heavens with torches. With these torches We have stoned the devils and We have prepared for them the torment of hell.
5.tr: Wa-laqad zaiyannas samaaa'ad dunyaa bimasaa-beeha Wa-ja'alnaahaa rujoomal lish-shayaateeni Wa-a'tadnaa lahum 'azaabas sa'eer

6.t: For those who have disbelieved in their Lord, We have prepared the torment of hell, the most terrible place to return.
6.tr: Wa-lillazeena kafaroo bi-rabbihim 'azaabu jahannama Wa-bi'sal maseer

7.t: When they are thrown into hell, they will hear its roaring while it boils.
7.tr: Izaaa ulqoo feehaa sami'oo lahaa shaheeqanw Wa-hiya tafoor

8.t: It almost explodes in rage. Whenever a group is thrown into it, its keepers will ask them, "Did no one come to warn you?"
8.tr: Takaadu tamayyazu minal ghaizz kullamaaa ulqiya feehaa fawjun sa-alahum khazanatuhaaa alam ya'tikum nazeer

9.t: They will say, "Yes, someone did come to warn us, but we rejected him saying, 'God has revealed nothing. You are in great error".
9.tr: Qaaloo balaa qad jaaa'anaa nazeerun fakazzabnaa Wa-qulnaa maa nazzalal laahu min shai-in in antum illaa fee dalaalin kabeer

10.t: They will also say, "Had We listened or used our minds, we would not have become the dwellers of hell".
10.tr: Wa-qaaloo law kunnaa nasma'u aw na'qilu maa kunnaa feee as-haabis sa'eer

11.t: They will confess to their sins, but the dwellers of hell will be far away from God's (mercy).

12.t: Those who fear their Lord in secret will receive forgiveness and a great reward.
12.tr: Innal lazeena yakhshawna rabbahum bilghaibi lahum maghfiratunw Wa-ajrun kabeer

13.t: Whether you conceal what you say or reveal it, God knows best all that the hearts contain.
13.tr: Wa-asirroo qawlakum awij haroo bih; innahoo 'aleemum bizaatis sudoor

14.t: Does the One Who is Subtle, All-aware, and Who created all things not know all about them?
14.tr: Alaa ya'lamu man khalaqa Wa-huwal lateeful khabeer

15.t: It is He who has made the earth subservient to you. You walk through its vast valleys and eat of its sustenance. Before Him you will all be resurrected.
15.tr: Huwal lazee ja'ala lakumul arda zaloolan famshoo fee manaakibihaa Wa-kuloo mir rizqih; Wa-ilaihin nushoor

16.t: Do you feel secure that the One in the heavens will not cause you to sink into the earth when it is violently shaking?
16.tr: A-amintum man fis samaaa'i ai yakhsifa bi-kumul arda fa-izaa hiya tamoor

17.t: Do you feel secure that the One in the heavens will not strike you with a sandstorm? You will soon know, with the coming of the torment, how serious Our warning was.
17.tr: Am amintum man fis samaaa'i ai yursila 'alaikum haasiba fasata'lamoona kaifa nazeer

18.t: Those who lived before them had also rejected Our warning, and how terrible was Our retribution!
18.tr: Wa-laqad kazzabal lazeena min qablihim fakaifa kaana nakeer

19.t: Did they not see the birds above them, stretching out, and flapping their wings. No one keeps them up in the sky except the Beneficent God. He certainly watches over all things.
19.tr: Awalam yaraw ilat tairi fawqahum saaaffaatinw Wa-yaqbidn; maa yumsikuhunna illaar rahmaan; innahoo bikulli shai-im baseer

20.t: Do you have any armies who will help you against the Beneficent God? The disbelievers are certainly deceived (by satan).
20.tr: Amman haazal lazee huwa jundul lakum yansurukum min doonir rahmaan; inil kaafiroona illaa fee ghuroor

21.t: Is there anyone who will provide you with sustenance if God were to deny you sustenance? In fact, they obstinately persist in their transgression and hatred.
21.tr: Amman haazal lazee yarzuqukum in amsaka rizqah; bal lajjoo fee 'utuwwinw Wa-nufoor

22.t: Can one who walks with his head hanging down be better guided that one who walks with his head upright?
22.tr: Afamai yamshee mukibban 'alaa wajhihee ahdaaa ammany yamshee sawiyyan 'alaa siratim mustaqeem

23.t: (Muhammad), say, "It is God who has brought you into being and made ears, eyes, and hearts for you, but you give very little thanks".
23.tr: Qul huwal lazee ansha-akum Wa-ja'ala lakumus sam'a wal-absaara wal-af'idata qaleelam maa tashkuroon

24.t: Say, "It is God who has settled you on the earth and to Him you will be resurrected".
24.tr: Qul huwal lazee zara-akum fil ardi Wa-ilaihi tuhsharoon

25.t: They say, "When will this torment take place if what you say is true?"
25.tr: Wa-yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen

26.t: Say, "God knows best. I am only one who gives warning".
26.tr: Qul innamal 'ilmu 'indal laahi Wa-innamaaa ana nazeerum mubeen

27.t: When they see the torment approaching, the faces of the disbelievers will blacken and they will be told, "This is what you wanted to (experience)".
27.tr: Falaammaa ra-awhu zulfatan seee'at wujoohul lazeena kafaroo Wa-qeela haazal lazee kuntum bihee tadda'oon

28.t: (Muhammad), say, "Have you not considered that regardless whether God forgives me and my followers or grants us mercy, but who will protect the disbelievers from a painful torment?
28.tr: Qul ara'aytum in ahlaka-niyal laahu Wa-mam ma'iya aw rahimanaa famai yujeerul kaafireena min 'azaabin aleem

29.t: Say, "He is the Beneficent One in whom we have faith and trust. You will soon know who is in manifest error".
29.tr: Qul huwar rahmaanu aamannaa bihee Wa-'alaihi tawakkalnaa fasata'lamoona man huwa fee dalaalim mubeen

30.t: Say, "Have you not thought that if your water was to dry up, who would bring you water from the spring?"
30.tr: Qul ara'aytum in asbaha maaa'ukum ghawran famai ya'teekum bimaaa'im ma'een
